1.title: Episode #2.1

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Captain America: The First Avenger" and "Another Earth"; the critics name their top 5 films of the year so far (or top 6, for Roger).

2.title: Episode #2.2

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Roger reviews "Cowboys & Aliens"; Christy and Ignatiy review "Crazy, Stupid, Love"; the critics name their worst films of the year so far.

3.title: Episode #2.3

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a vintage episode of "Sneak Previews" from 1980, in which Gene Siskel and Roger Ebert showed the process of how they went about doing their reviews.

4.title: Classics from the Vault: Mel Brooks or Woody Allen?

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a 1980 episode of "Sneak Previews" titled "Mel Brooks or Woody Allen?" in which Gene Siskel and Roger Ebert debate which filmmaker is funnier, with Gene choosing Allen and Roger choosing Brooks.

5.title: Classics from the Vault: Great Performances That Oscar Ignored

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a 1980 episode of "Sneak Previews" in which Gene Siskel and Roger Ebert discuss "Great Performances That Oscar Ignored."

6.title: Episode #2.6

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a 1979 episode of "Sneak Previews" in which Roger Ebert and Gene Siskel discuss the movies of 1978.

7.title: Classics from the Vault: Movies that Changed the Movies

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a 1979 episode of "Sneak Previews" in which Roger Ebert and Gene Siskel discuss surprise hit films which became influential by starting trends.

8.title: Classics from the Vault: Changing Attitudes Toward Homosexuality

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a 1982 episode of "Sneak Previews" in which Gene Siskel and Roger Ebert discuss changing attitudes toward homosexuality in the movies.

9.title: Classics from the Vault: Women in Danger

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

9.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a 1980 episode of "Sneak Previews" in which Gene Siskel and Roger Ebert discuss the trend of horror movies focusing on violence against women.

10.title: Classics from the Vault: Changing Sex Roles

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

10.plot: Christy and Ignatiy introduce a 1980 episode of "Sneak Previews" in which Roger Ebert and Gene Siskel describe changes in the way men and women are portrayed in Hollywood movies.

11.title: Episode #2.11

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

11.plot: Christy, Ignatiy, director Don DuPree, and executive producer Chaz Ebert discuss how "Ebert Presents: At the Movies" came to be.

12.title: Episode #2.12

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

12.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "The Ides of March," "50/50," "Real Steel," "Moneyball," and "Drive"; Roger reviews "The Interrupters."

13.title: Episode #2.13

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

13.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Footloose," "Take Shelter," "The Women on the 6th Floor," "Father of Invention," and "The Human Centipede 2." Christy reviews "The Skin I Live In" alone. Roger reviews "The Big Year."

14.title: Episode #2.14

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

14.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Margin Call," "Martha Marcy May Marlene," "Texas Killing Fields," and "Johnny English Reborn." Ignatiy reviews "The Three Musketeers." Roger reviews "The Thing" and "Le Havre." Chaz Ebert reviews "Thunder Soul."

15.title: Episode #2.15

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

15.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Puss in Boots," "The Rum Diary," "Like Crazy," "Anonymous," and "The Catechism Cataclysm." Roger does a Great Movies segment on "Nosferatu." Kevin Lee reports on the current movie scene in China.

16.title: Episode #2.16

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

16.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "J. Edgar," "Janie Jones," "Tower Heist," "Boy Wonder," "In Time," "The Son of No One," and "Killing Bono." Roger reviews "Oranges and Sunshine."

17.title: Episode #2.17

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

17.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Melancholia," "J. Edgar," and "Elite Squad: The Enemy Within"; Roger reviews "Into the Abyss" and does a Great Movies segment on "This Is Spinal Tap."

18.title: Episode #2.18

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

18.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "The Descendants," "The Greening of Whitney Brown," "Immortals," "Happy Feet Two," and "Jack and Jill"; Roger discusses the 30th anniversary restoration of "Raiders of the Lost Ark."

19.title: Episode #2.19

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

19.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Hugo," "The Artist," "The Muppets," "A Dangerous Method," and "My Week with Marilyn". Roger reviews "The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1."

21.title: Episode #2.21

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

21.plot: A special episode deals with the portrayal of African Americans in the movies, featuring contributors Kartina Richardson and Jay Smith and a clip from a 1981 episode of "Sneak Previews" with Roger Ebert and Gene Siskel.

22.title: Episode #2.22

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

22.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows," "Carnage," "New Year's Eve," "Young Adult," "Alvin and the Chipmunks: Chipwrecked," and "The Sitter"; Roger reviews "Kinyarwanda."

23.title: Episode #2.23

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

23.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol," "Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close," "We Bought a Zoo," "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo," "War Horse," and "The Adventures of Tintin"; Roger reviews "Passione."

24.title: Episode #2.24

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

24.plot: Christy, Ignatiy, and Roger each name their choices for the five best films of 2011 and the single worst film of the year.

0.plot:

1.title: Episode #1.1

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Ignatiy Vishnevetsky and Christy Lemire review new films opening this week. In this episode, Christy and Ignatiy review 'No Strings Attached', 'The Company Men', 'The Way Back', 'The Dilemma' and 'The Green Hornet' . Ignatiy and Christy split on all five films. Ignatiy gave all five films a thumbs up, and Christy Lemire gave all five films a thumbs down. Kim Morgan discusses the 1949 classic, 'The Third Man'. In the 'Roger's Office' segment, director Werner Herzog provides the voice of Roger Ebert as he reviews the film, 'My Dog Tulip'.

2.title: Episode #1.2

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "The Mechanic," "Another Year," "Barney's Version," "Biutiful," and "The Illusionist"; Roger reviews "The Rite"; Kartina Richardson comments on "Black Swan."

3.title: Episode #1.3

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "The Other Woman," "Cold Weather," "Louder Than a Bomb," and "The Housemaid"; Roger reviews "Sanctum" and the newly reissued "The Leopard"; and Jeff Greenfield discusses unrealistic speeches in political movies.

4.title: Episode #1.4

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: The critics select the movies that made them critics. Christy selects "The Breakfast Club," "Nights of Cabiria," "Magnolia," "No Country for Old Men," and "The Wizard of Oz." Ignatiy selects "True Heart Susie," "Foolish Wives," "Play Time," "Shoah," and "Histoire(s) du cinéma." Clips from Roger's choice, "Citizen Kane," are accompanied by excerpts from his commentary for the DVD of the film.

5.title: Episode #1.5

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot:

6.title: Episode #1.6

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Hall Pass," "Brotherhood," "Vanishing on 7th Street," and "Poetry"; Roger reviews "Even the Rain"; Jeff Greenfield and David Poland offer Oscar-related commentary.

7.title: Episode #1.7

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review six films including "The Adjustment Bureau" and "Rango"; Roger reviews "I Will Follow"; Jeff Greenfield comments on language in film.

8.title: Episode #1.8

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Jane Eyre," "Mars Needs Moms," "Of Gods and Men," "Certified Copy", and "Red Riding Hood"; Roger reviews "Battle: Los Angeles"; Matt Singer discusses films shot on iPhones and other consumer electronic equipment.

9.title: Episode #1.9

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

9.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Paul," "Win Win," "Cracks," and "The Lincoln Lawyer"; Roger reviews "Limitless" and does a Great Movies segment on the 1943 "Jane Eyre"; Alison Bailes discusses documentaries about environmental issues.

10.title: Episode #1.10

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

10.plot: Roger reviews "Source Code"; reviews are repeated from earlier episodes which were preempted in some cities for pledge drives.

11.title: Episode #1.11

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

11.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Insidious," "In a Better World," "Hop," and "Super"; Roger's review of "Source Code" is repeated from last week's episode; Jeff Greenfield discusses baseball movies.

12.title: Episode #1.12

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

12.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Arthur," "Hanna," and the "Mildred Pierce" miniseries; Roger reviews "Your Highness"; Nell Minow discusses films where the villain is a corporation.

13.title: Episode #1.13

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

13.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Trust," "The Conspirator", "Henry's Crime," and "White Irish Drinkers"; Roger reviews "Scream 4" and "Rio"; Kartina Richardson pays tribute to the "Thin Man" movies.

14.title: Episode #1.14

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

14.plot: Ignatiy and Christy review "African Cats," "Miral," "The Greatest Movie Ever Sold," "Incendies," and "The Bang Bang Club"; Roger reviews "Water for Elephants"; and David Poland pays tribute to Sidney Lumet.

15.title: Episode #1.15

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

15.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Prom," "Sympathy for Delicious," "Cave of Forgotten Dreams," and "13 Assassins," and respond to questions from viewers; Roger reviews "Fast Five."

16.title: Episode #1.16

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

16.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Thor," "Something Borrowed," "Hobo with a Shotgun," and "The Beaver"; Roger reviews "Jumping the Broom."

17.title: Episode #1.17

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

17.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Bridesmaids," "Everything Must Go," "Passion Play," "The First Grader," and "Skateland"; Roger reviews "There Be Dragons"; Omar Moore discusses Alfred Hitchcock's "The Wrong Man."

18.title: Episode #1.18

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

18.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides," "Earthwork," "Midnight in Paris," "Too Big to Fail," and "How to Die in Oregon"; Roger reviews "A Small Act"; Chaz Ebert reports from the Cannes Film Festival.

19.title: Episode #1.19

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

19.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "The Tree of Life," "Kung Fu Panda 2," and "Forks Over Knives"; Roger reviews "The Hangover Part II" and "Make Believe"; Chaz Ebert reports from Cannes; Kartina Richardson discusses Terrence Malick's "Badlands."

20.title: Episode #1.20

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

20.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Beautiful Boy," "Beginners," "Film Socialisme," "Submarine," and "Tuesday, After Christmas"; Roger reviews "X-Men: First Class"; Matt Singer discusses "Videodrome."

21.title: Episode #1.21

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

21.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Super 8" and "The Trip"; Roger reviews "Midnight in Paris"; Kevin Lee reports on South Korean films from the Jeonju International Film Festival; reviews of other films are repeated from earlier episodes.

22.title: Episode #1.22

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

22.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Green Lantern," "The Art of Getting By," "Buck," "Mr. Popper's Penguins," and "Page One"; Roger discusses "The Bride of Frankenstein"; Kartina Richardson discusses "Who's That Knocking at My Door?".

23.title: Episode #1.23

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

23.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Conan O'Brien Can't Stop," "A Better Life," "Road to Nowhere," and "Rejoice and Shout"; Roger reviews "Cars 2" and does a Great Movies segment on "Say Amen, Somebody."

24.title: Episode #1.24

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

24.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Transformers: Dark of the Moon," "Bad Teacher," "Larry Crowne," "Beats Rhymes & Life," "Cars 2," and "Terri"; Roger pays tribute to Peter Falk's work in "Wings of Desire" and "A Woman Under the Influence."

25.title: Episode #1.25

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

25.plot: The critics discuss the trend of films being released in 3D.

26.title: Episode #1.26

episode of.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (TV Series 2010– )

26.plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2," "Horrible Bosses," "Zookeeper," "Lucky," "The Ward," and "Project Nim"; Roger reviews "Tabloid"; David Poland discusses Stanley Kubrick.

imdb.plot outline: Following the classic format from the original PBS days of Sneak Previews (1975), this new PBS show has Christy Lemire and Ignatiy Vishnevetsky reviewing the latest films and argue their opinions. In addition, the renowned film critic who helped create this TV show genre, Roger Ebert, contributes his own reviews in his own section. Considering his health problems have robbed him the ability to speak, Ebert's written reviews are read by guest speakers ready to give him a hand.
imdb.title: Ebert Presents: At the Movies
akas: Ebert Presents: At the Movies (United States)
plot: Two new film critics, as well as the renowned critic, Roger Ebert, review newly-released films.::Kenneth Chisholm

Following the classic format from the original PBS days of _Sneak Previews (1975)_ (qv), this new PBS show has Christy Lemire and Ignatiy Vishnevetsky reviewing the latest films and argue their opinions. In addition, the renowned film critic who helped create this TV show genre, Roger Ebert, contributes his own reviews in his own section. Considering his health problems have robbed him the ability to speak, Ebert's written reviews are read by guest speakers ready to give him a hand.::Kenneth Chisholm (kchishol@rogers.com)
